121.7: The LORD will protect you from all evil; He will keep your soul.
121.3: He will not allow your foot to slip; He who keeps you will not slumber.

121.1: A Song of Ascents. I will lift up my eyes to the mountains; From where shall my help come?
121.4: Behold, He who keeps Israel Will neither slumber nor sleep.
121.6: The sun will not smite you by day, Nor the moon by night.
121.5: The LORD is your keeper; The LORD is your shade on your right hand.

31.16: Make Your face to shine upon Your servant; Save me in Your lovingkindness.
31.3: For You are my rock and my fortress; For Your name's sake You will lead me and guide me.
31.5: Into Your hand I commit my spirit; You have ransomed me, O LORD, God of truth.
31.21: Blessed be the LORD, For He has made marvelous His lovingkindness to me in a besieged city.
31.18: Let the lying lips be mute, Which speak arrogantly against the righteous With pride and contempt.
31.12: I am forgotten as a dead man, out of mind; I am like a broken vessel.
31.10: For my life is spent with sorrow And my years with sighing; My strength has failed because of my iniquity, And my body has wasted away.
31.2: Incline Your ear to me, rescue me quickly; Be to me a rock of strength, A stronghold to save me.
31.22: As for me, I said in my alarm, 'I am cut off from before Your eyes'; Nevertheless You heard the voice of my supplications When I cried to You.
31.8: And You have not given me over into the hand of the enemy; You have set my feet in a large place.
31.17: Let me not be put to shame, O LORD, for I call upon You; Let the wicked be put to shame, let them be silent in Sheol.
31.11: Because of all my adversaries, I have become a reproach, Especially to my neighbors, And an object of dread to my acquaintances; Those who see me in the street flee from me.
31.1: For the choir director. A Psalm of David. In You, O LORD, I have taken refuge; Let me never be ashamed; In Your righteousness deliver me.
31.9: Be gracious to me, O LORD, for I am in distress; My eye is wasted away from grief, my soul and my body [also].
31.24: Be strong and let your heart take courage, All you who hope in the LORD.
31.14: But as for me, I trust in You, O LORD, I say, 'You are my God.'
31.7: I will rejoice and be glad in Your lovingkindness, Because You have seen my affliction; You have known the troubles of my soul,
31.15: My times are in Your hand; Deliver me from the hand of my enemies and from those who persecute me.
31.20: You hide them in the secret place of Your presence from the conspiracies of man; You keep them secretly in a shelter from the strife of tongues.
31.23: O love the LORD, all you His godly ones! The LORD preserves the faithful And fully recompenses the proud doer.
31.6: I hate those who regard vain idols, But I trust in the LORD.
31.4: You will pull me out of the net which they have secretly laid for me, For You are my strength.
31.19: How great is Your goodness, Which You have stored up for those who fear You, Which You have wrought for those who take refuge in You, Before the sons of men!
31.13: For I have heard the slander of many, Terror is on every side; While they took counsel together against me, They schemed to take away my life.

117.2: For His lovingkindness is great toward us, And the truth of the LORD is everlasting. Praise the LORD!
117.1: Praise the LORD, all nations; Laud Him, all peoples!

59.16: But as for me, I shall sing of Your strength; Yes, I shall joyfully sing of Your lovingkindness in the morning, For You have been my stronghold And a refuge in the day of my distress.

59.12: [On account of] the sin of their mouth [and] the words of their lips, Let them even be caught in their pride, And on account of curses and lies which they utter.

59.2: Deliver me from those who do iniquity And save me from men of bloodshed.

59.17: O my strength, I will sing praises to You; For God is my stronghold, the God who shows me lovingkindness.

59.1: For the choir director; [set to] Al-tashheth. A Mikhtam of David, when Saul sent [men] and they watched the house in order to kill him. Deliver me from my enemies, O my God; Set me [securely] on high away from those who rise up against me.
59.9: [Because of] his strength I will watch for You, For God is my stronghold.
59.14: They return at evening, they howl like a dog, And go around the city.
59.7: Behold, they belch forth with their mouth; Swords are in their lips, For, [they say], 'Who hears?'
59.15: They wander about for food And growl if they are not satisfied.
59.6: They return at evening, they howl like a dog, And go around the city.
59.4: For no guilt of [mine], they run and set themselves against me. Arouse Yourself to help me, and see!
59.13: Destroy [them] in wrath, destroy [them] that they may be no more; That [men] may know that God rules in Jacob To the ends of the earth. Selah.

5.7: But as for me, by Your abundant lovingkindness I will enter Your house, At Your holy temple I will bow in reverence for You.
5.9: There is nothing reliable in what they say; Their inward part is destruction [itself]. Their throat is an open grave; They flatter with their tongue.
5.10: Hold them guilty, O God; By their own devices let them fall! In the multitude of their transgressions thrust them out, For they are rebellious against You.
5.3: In the morning, O LORD, You will hear my voice; In the morning I will order [my] [prayer] to You and [eagerly] watch.
5.11: But let all who take refuge in You be glad, Let them ever sing for joy; And may You shelter them, That those who love Your name may exult in You.
5.2: Heed the sound of my cry for help, my King and my God, For to You I pray.
5.1: For the choir director; for flute accompaniment. A Psalm of David. Give ear to my words, O LORD, Consider my groaning.
5.12: For it is You who blesses the righteous man, O LORD, You surround him with favor as with a shield.
5.4: For You are not a God who takes pleasure in wickedness; No evil dwells with You.
5.6: You destroy those who speak falsehood; The LORD abhors the man of bloodshed and deceit.
5.5: The boastful shall not stand before Your eyes; You hate all who do iniquity.
5.8: O LORD, lead me in Your righteousness because of my foes; Make Your way straight before me.

53.3: Every one of them has turned aside; together they have become corrupt; There is no one who does good, not even one.
53.2: God has looked down from heaven upon the sons of men To see if there is anyone who understands, Who seeks after God.
53.1: For the choir director; according to Mahalath. A Maskil of David. The fool has said in his heart, 'There is no God,' They are corrupt, and have committed abominable injustice; There is no one who does good.
53.4: Have the workers of wickedness no knowledge, Who eat up My people [as though] they ate bread And have not called upon God?
53.6: Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion! When God restores His captive people, Let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad.
53.5: There they were in great fear [where] no fear had been; For God scattered the bones of him who encamped against you; You put [them] to shame, because God had rejected them.

47.7: For God is the King of all the earth; Sing praises with a skillful psalm.

47.3: He subdues peoples under us And nations under our feet.
47.2: For the LORD Most High is to be feared, A great King over all the earth.
47.1: For the choir director. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. O clap your hands, all peoples; Shout to God with the voice of joy.
47.4: He chooses our inheritance for us, The glory of Jacob whom He loves. Selah.
47.6: Sing praises to God, sing praises; Sing praises to our King, sing praises.
47.5: God has ascended with a shout, The LORD, with the sound of a trumpet.
47.8: God reigns over the nations, God sits on His holy throne.

100.2: Serve the LORD with gladness; Come before Him with joyful singing.
100.4: Enter His gates with thanksgiving [And] His courts with praise. Give thanks to Him, bless His name.
100.5: For the LORD is good; His lovingkindness is everlasting And His faithfulness to all generations.
100.1: A Psalm for Thanksgiving. Shout joyfully to the LORD, all the earth.
100.3: Know that the LORD Himself is God; It is He who has made us, and not we ourselves; [We are] His people and the sheep of His pasture.

78.10: They did not keep the covenant of God And refused to walk in His law;
78.63: Fire devoured His young men, And His virgins had no wedding songs.

78.71: From the care of the ewes with suckling lambs He brought him To shepherd Jacob His people, And Israel His inheritance.
78.3: Which we have heard and known, And our fathers have told us.
78.8: And not be like their fathers, A stubborn and rebellious generation, A generation that did not prepare its heart And whose spirit was not faithful to God.

78.65: Then the Lord awoke as [if from] sleep, Like a warrior overcome by wine.
78.40: How often they rebelled against Him in the wilderness And grieved Him in the desert!
78.14: Then He led them with the cloud by day And all the night with a light of fire.

78.17: Yet they still continued to sin against Him, To rebel against the Most High in the desert.

78.66: He drove His adversaries backward; He put on them an everlasting reproach.
78.57: But turned back and acted treacherously like their fathers; They turned aside like a treacherous bow.
78.43: When He performed His signs in Egypt And His marvels in the field of Zoan,

78.2: I will open my mouth in a parable; I will utter dark sayings of old,

78.37: For their heart was not steadfast toward Him, Nor were they faithful in His covenant.
78.7: That they should put their confidence in God And not forget the works of God, But keep His commandments,
78.52: But He led forth His own people like sheep And guided them in the wilderness like a flock;
78.39: Thus He remembered that they were but flesh, A wind that passes and does not return.

78.56: Yet they tempted and rebelled against the Most High God And did not keep His testimonies,
78.46: He gave also their crops to the grasshopper And the product of their labor to the locust.

78.15: He split the rocks in the wilderness And gave [them] abundant drink like the ocean depths.

89.11: The heavens are Yours, the earth also is Yours; The world and all it contains, You have founded them.

89.20: 'I have found David My servant; With My holy oil I have anointed him,

89.23: 'But I shall crush his adversaries before him, And strike those who hate him.

89.1: A Maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite. I will sing of the lovingkindness of the LORD forever; To all generations I will make known Your faithfulness with my mouth.

89.8: O LORD God of hosts, who is like You, O mighty LORD? Your faithfulness also surrounds You.
89.26: 'He will cry to Me, 'You are my Father, My God, and the rock of my salvation.'
89.39: You have spurned the covenant of Your servant; You have profaned his crown in the dust.

89.37: 'It shall be established forever like the moon, And the witness in the sky is faithful.' Selah.
89.22: 'The enemy will not deceive him, Nor the son of wickedness afflict him.

89.35: 'Once I have sworn by My holiness; I will not lie to David.

108.3: I will give thanks to You, O LORD, among the peoples, And I will sing praises to You among the nations.

39.3: My heart was hot within me, While I was musing the fire burned; [Then] I spoke with my tongue:
39.5: 'Behold, You have made my days [as] handbreadths, And my lifetime as nothing in Your sight; Surely every man at his best is a mere breath. Selah.
39.12: 'Hear my prayer, O LORD, and give ear to my cry; Do not be silent at my tears; For I am a stranger with You, A sojourner like all my fathers.
39.10: 'Remove Your plague from me; Because of the opposition of Your hand I am perishing.
39.2: I was mute and silent, I refrained [even] from good, And my sorrow grew worse.
39.8: 'Deliver me from all my transgressions; Make me not the reproach of the foolish.
39.11: 'With reproofs You chasten a man for iniquity; You consume as a moth what is precious to him; Surely every man is a mere breath. Selah.
39.1: For the choir director, for Jeduthun. A Psalm of David. I said, 'I will guard my ways That I may not sin with my tongue; I will guard my mouth as with a muzzle While the wicked are in my presence.'
39.9: 'I have become mute, I do not open my mouth, Because it is You who have done [it].
39.7: 'And now, Lord, for what do I wait? My hope is in You.
39.6: 'Surely every man walks about as a phantom; Surely they make an uproar for nothing; He amasses [riches] and does not know who will gather them.
39.4: 'LORD, make me to know my end And what is the extent of my days; Let me know how transient I am.
39.13: 'Turn Your gaze away from me, that I may smile [again] Before I depart and am no more.'

23.3: He restores my soul; He guides me in the paths of righteousness For His name's sake.

72.16: May there be abundance of grain in the earth on top of the mountains; Its fruit will wave like [the cedars of] Lebanon; And may those from the city flourish like vegetation of the earth.

72.7: In his days may the righteous flourish, And abundance of peace till the moon is no more.

45.16: In place of your fathers will be your sons; You shall make them princes in all the earth.

45.1: For the choir director; according to the Shoshannim. A Maskil of the sons of Korah. A Song of Love. My heart overflows with a good theme; I address my verses to the King; My tongue is the pen of a ready writer.

14.7: Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion! When the LORD restores His captive people, Jacob will rejoice, Israel will be glad.

103.16: When the wind has passed over it, it is no more, And its place acknowledges it no longer.

87.7: Then those who sing as well as those who play the flutes [shall say], 'All my springs [of joy] are in you.'

49.16: Do not be afraid when a man becomes rich, When the glory of his house is increased;

116.16: O LORD, surely I am Your servant, I am Your servant, the son of Your handmaid, You have loosed my bonds.

81.16: 'But I would feed you with the finest of the wheat, And with honey from the rock I would satisfy you.'

125.2: As the mountains surround Jerusalem, So the LORD surrounds His people From this time forth and forever.

3.7: Arise, O LORD; save me, O my God! For You have smitten all my enemies on the cheek; You have shattered the teeth of the wicked.

32.7: You are my hiding place; You preserve me from trouble; You surround me with songs of deliverance. Selah.

8.7: All sheep and oxen, And also the beasts of the field,

29.7: The voice of the LORD hews out flames of fire.

2.7: 'I will surely tell of the decree of the LORD: He said to Me, 'You are My Son, Today I have begotten You.

62.7: On God my salvation and my glory [rest]; The rock of my strength, my refuge is in God.
62.9: Men of low degree are only vanity and men of rank are a lie; In the balances they go up; They are together lighter than breath.

62.2: He only is my rock and my salvation, My stronghold; I shall not be greatly shaken.
62.1: For the choir director; according to Jeduthun. A Psalm of David. My soul [waits] in silence for God only; From Him is my salvation.
62.12: And lovingkindness is Yours, O Lord, For You recompense a man according to his work.

62.8: Trust in Him at all times, O people; Pour out your heart before Him; God is a refuge for us. Selah.

33.16: The king is not saved by a mighty army; A warrior is not delivered by great strength.

33.9: For He spoke, and it was done; He commanded, and it stood fast.

33.15: He who fashions the hearts of them all, He who understands all their works.

33.6: By the word of the LORD the heavens were made, And by the breath of His mouth all their host.
33.4: For the word of the LORD is upright, And all His work is [done] in faithfulness.

84.7: They go from strength to strength, [Every one of them] appears before God in Zion.

107.11: Because they had rebelled against the words of God And spurned the counsel of the Most High.

139.16: Your eyes have seen my unformed substance; And in Your book were all written The days that were ordained [for me], When as yet there was not one of them.

139.10: Even there Your hand will lead me, And Your right hand will lay hold of me.
139.2: You know when I sit down and when I rise up; You understand my thought from afar.
139.22: I hate them with the utmost hatred; They have become my enemies.

139.1: For the choir director. A Psalm of David. O LORD, You have searched me and known [me].
139.9: If I take the wings of the dawn, If I dwell in the remotest part of the sea,
139.24: And see if there be any hurtful way in me, And lead me in the everlasting way.

42.7: Deep calls to deep at the sound of Your waterfalls; All Your breakers and Your waves have rolled over me.

35.11: Malicious witnesses rise up; They ask me of things that I do not know.

74.5: It seems as if one had lifted up [His] axe in a forest of trees.
74.21: Let not the oppressed return dishonored; Let the afflicted and needy praise Your name.
74.18: Remember this, O LORD, that the enemy has reviled, And a foolish people has spurned Your name.
74.12: Yet God is my king from of old, Who works deeds of deliverance in the midst of the earth.
74.10: How long, O God, will the adversary revile, [And] the enemy spurn Your name forever?
74.2: Remember Your congregation, which You have purchased of old, Which You have redeemed to be the tribe of Your inheritance; [And] this Mount Zion, where You have dwelt.
74.22: Arise, O God, [and] plead Your own cause; Remember how the foolish man reproaches You all day long.
74.8: They said in their heart, 'Let us completely subdue them.' They have burned all the meeting places of God in the land.
74.17: You have established all the boundaries of the earth; You have made summer and winter.
74.11: Why do You withdraw Your hand, even Your right hand? From within Your bosom, destroy [them]!
74.1: A Maskil of Asaph. O God, why have You rejected [us] forever? Why does Your anger smoke against the sheep of Your pasture?
74.9: We do not see our signs; There is no longer any prophet, Nor is there any among us who knows how long.
74.14: You crushed the heads of Leviathan; You gave him as food for the creatures of the wilderness.
74.7: They have burned Your sanctuary to the ground; They have defiled the dwelling place of Your name.
74.15: You broke open springs and torrents; You dried up ever-flowing streams.
74.20: Consider the covenant; For the dark places of the land are full of the habitations of violence.
74.23: Do not forget the voice of Your adversaries, The uproar of those who rise against You which ascends continually.
74.6: And now all its carved work They smash with hatchet and hammers.
74.4: Your adversaries have roared in the midst of Your meeting place; They have set up their own standards for signs.
74.19: Do not deliver the soul of Your turtledove to the wild beast; Do not forget the life of Your afflicted forever.
74.13: You divided the sea by Your strength; You broke the heads of the sea monsters in the waters.

147.16: He gives snow like wool; He scatters the frost like ashes.
147.3: He heals the brokenhearted And binds up their wounds.
147.5: Great is our Lord and abundant in strength; His understanding is infinite.
147.18: He sends forth His word and melts them; He causes His wind to blow and the waters to flow.
147.12: Praise the LORD, O Jerusalem! Praise your God, O Zion!
147.10: He does not delight in the strength of the horse; He does not take pleasure in the legs of a man.
147.2: The LORD builds up Jerusalem; He gathers the outcasts of Israel.
147.8: Who covers the heavens with clouds, Who provides rain for the earth, Who makes grass to grow on the mountains.
147.17: He casts forth His ice as fragments; Who can stand before His cold?
147.11: The LORD favors those who fear Him, Those who wait for His lovingkindness.
147.1: Praise the LORD! For it is good to sing praises to our God; For it is pleasant [and] praise is becoming.
147.9: He gives to the beast its food, [And] to the young ravens which cry.
147.14: He makes peace in your borders; He satisfies you with the finest of the wheat.
147.7: Sing to the LORD with thanksgiving; Sing praises to our God on the lyre,
147.15: He sends forth His command to the earth; His word runs very swiftly.
147.20: He has not dealt thus with any nation; And as for His ordinances, they have not known them. Praise the LORD!
147.6: The LORD supports the afflicted; He brings down the wicked to the ground.
147.4: He counts the number of the stars; He gives names to all of them.
147.19: He declares His words to Jacob, His statutes and His ordinances to Israel.
147.13: For He has strengthened the bars of your gates; He has blessed your sons within you.

98.7: Let the sea roar and all it contains, The world and those who dwell in it.
98.9: Before the LORD, for He is coming to judge the earth; He will judge the world with righteousness And the peoples with equity.
98.3: He has remembered His lovingkindness and His faithfulness to the house of Israel; All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
98.2: The LORD has made known His salvation; He has revealed His righteousness in the sight of the nations.
98.1: A Psalm. O sing to the LORD a new song, For He has done wonderful things, His right hand and His holy arm have gained the victory for Him.
98.4: Shout joyfully to the LORD, all the earth; Break forth and sing for joy and sing praises.
98.6: With trumpets and the sound of the horn Shout joyfully before the King, the LORD.
98.5: Sing praises to the LORD with the lyre, With the lyre and the sound of melody.
98.8: Let the rivers clap their hands, Let the mountains sing together for joy

70.2: Let those be ashamed and humiliated Who seek my life; Let those be turned back and dishonored Who delight in my hurt.
70.4: Let all who seek You rejoice and be glad in You; And let those who love Your salvation say continually, 'Let God be magnified.'
70.5: But I am afflicted and needy; Hasten to me, O God! You are my help and my deliverer; O LORD, do not delay.
70.1: For the choir director. [A Psalm] of David; for a memorial. O God, [hasten] to deliver me; O LORD, hasten to my help!
70.3: Let those be turned back because of their shame Who say, 'Aha, aha!'

17.3: You have tried my heart; You have visited [me] by night; You have tested me and You find nothing; I have purposed that my mouth will not transgress.
17.5: My steps have held fast to Your paths. My feet have not slipped.
17.12: He is like a lion that is eager to tear, And as a young lion lurking in hiding places.
17.10: They have closed their unfeeling [heart], With their mouth they speak proudly.
17.2: Let my judgment come forth from Your presence; Let Your eyes look with equity.
17.8: Keep me as the apple of the eye; Hide me in the shadow of Your wings
17.11: They have now surrounded us in our steps; They set their eyes to cast [us] down to the ground.
17.1: A Prayer of David. Hear a just cause, O LORD, give heed to my cry; Give ear to my prayer, which is not from deceitful lips.
17.9: From the wicked who despoil me, My deadly enemies who surround me.
17.14: From men with Your hand, O LORD, From men of the world, whose portion is in [this] life, And whose belly You fill with Your treasure; They are satisfied with children, And leave their abundance to their babes.
17.7: Wondrously show Your lovingkindness, O Savior of those who take refuge at Your right hand From those who rise up [against them].
17.15: As for me, I shall behold Your face in righteousness; I will be satisfied with Your likeness when I awake.
17.6: I have called upon You, for You will answer me, O God; Incline Your ear to me, hear my speech.
17.4: As for the deeds of men, by the word of Your lips I have kept from the paths of the violent.
17.13: Arise, O LORD, confront him, bring him low; Deliver my soul from the wicked with Your sword,

69.11: When I made sackcloth my clothing, I became a byword to them.
69.3: I am weary with my crying; my throat is parched; My eyes fail while I wait for my God.
69.20: Reproach has broken my heart and I am so sick. And I looked for sympathy, but there was none, And for comforters, but I found none.
69.12: Those who sit in the gate talk about me, And I [am] the song of the drunkards.
69.10: When I wept in my soul with fasting, It became my reproach.
69.17: And do not hide Your face from Your servant, For I am in distress; answer me quickly.
69.13: But as for me, my prayer is to You, O LORD, at an acceptable time; O God, in the greatness of Your lovingkindness, Answer me with Your saving truth.
69.27: Add iniquity to their iniquity, And may they not come into Your righteousness.
69.30: I will praise the name of God with song And magnify Him with thanksgiving.
69.18: Oh draw near to my soul [and] redeem it; Ransom me because of my enemies!
69.36: The descendants of His servants will inherit it, And those who love His name will dwell in it.
69.29: But I am afflicted and in pain; May Your salvation, O God, set me [securely] on high.
69.23: May their eyes grow dim so that they cannot see, And make their loins shake continually.
69.19: You know my reproach and my shame and my dishonor; All my adversaries are before You.
69.1: For the choir director; according to Shoshannim. [A Psalm] of David. Save me, O God, For the waters have threatened my life.
69.5: O God, it is You who knows my folly, And my wrongs are not hidden from You.
69.4: Those who hate me without a cause are more than the hairs of my head; Those who would destroy me are powerful, being wrongfully my enemies; What I did not steal, I then have to restore.
69.8: I have become estranged from my brothers And an alien to my mother's sons.
69.26: For they have persecuted him whom You Yourself have smitten, And they tell of the pain of those whom You have wounded.
69.14: Deliver me from the mire and do not let me sink; May I be delivered from my foes and from the deep waters.
69.22: May their table before them become a snare; And when they are in peace, [may it become] a trap.
69.28: May they be blotted out of the book of life And may they not be recorded with the righteous.
69.25: May their camp be desolate; May none dwell in their tents.
69.9: For zeal for Your house has consumed me, And the reproaches of those who reproach You have fallen on me.
69.33: For the LORD hears the needy And does not despise His [who are] prisoners.
69.15: May the flood of water not overflow me Nor the deep swallow me up, Nor the pit shut its mouth on me.
69.34: Let heaven and earth praise Him, The seas and everything that moves in them.
69.21: They also gave me gall for my food And for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
69.24: Pour out Your indignation on them, And may Your burning anger overtake them.
69.16: Answer me, O LORD, for Your lovingkindness is good; According to the greatness of Your compassion, turn to me,
69.35: For God will save Zion and build the cities of Judah, That they may dwell there and possess it.
69.32: The humble have seen [it and] are glad; You who seek God, let your heart revive.
69.7: Because for Your sake I have borne reproach; Dishonor has covered my face.
69.2: I have sunk in deep mire, and there is no foothold; I have come into deep waters, and a flood overflows me.
69.6: May those who wait for You not be ashamed through me, O Lord GOD of hosts; May those who seek You not be dishonored through me, O God of Israel,
69.31: And it will please the LORD better than an ox [Or] a young bull with horns and hoofs.

88.16: Your burning anger has passed over me; Your terrors have destroyed me.
88.3: For my soul has had enough troubles, And my life has drawn near to Sheol.
88.5: Forsaken among the dead, Like the slain who lie in the grave, Whom You remember no more, And they are cut off from Your hand.
88.18: You have removed lover and friend far from me; My acquaintances are [in] darkness.
88.12: Will Your wonders be made known in the darkness? And Your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
88.10: Will You perform wonders for the dead? Will the departed spirits rise [and] praise You? Selah.
88.2: Let my prayer come before You; Incline Your ear to my cry!
88.8: You have removed my acquaintances far from me; You have made me an object of loathing to them; I am shut up and cannot go out.
88.17: They have surrounded me like water all day long; They have encompassed me altogether.
88.11: Will Your lovingkindness be declared in the grave, Your faithfulness in Abaddon?
88.1: A Song. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. For the choir director; according to Mahalath Leannoth. A Maskil of Heman the Ezrahite. O LORD, the God of my salvation, I have cried out by day and in the night before You.
88.9: My eye has wasted away because of affliction; I have called upon You every day, O LORD; I have spread out my hands to You.
88.14: O LORD, why do You reject my soul? [Why] do You hide Your face from me?
88.7: Your wrath has rested upon me, And You have afflicted me with all Your waves. Selah.
88.15: I was afflicted and about to die from my youth on; I suffer Your terrors; I am overcome.
88.6: You have put me in the lowest pit, In dark places, in the depths.
88.4: I am reckoned among those who go down to the pit; I have become like a man without strength,
88.13: But I, O LORD, have cried out to You for help, And in the morning my prayer comes before You.

102.11: My days are like a lengthened shadow, And I wither away like grass.
102.3: For my days have been consumed in smoke, And my bones have been scorched like a hearth.
102.20: To hear the groaning of the prisoner, To set free those who were doomed to death,
102.12: But You, O LORD, abide forever, And Your name to all generations.
102.10: Because of Your indignation and Your wrath, For You have lifted me up and cast me away.
102.17: He has regarded the prayer of the destitute And has not despised their prayer.
102.13: You will arise [and] have compassion on Zion; For it is time to be gracious to her, For the appointed time has come.
102.27: 'But You are the same, And Your years will not come to an end.
102.18: This will be written for the generation to come, That a people yet to be created may praise the LORD.
102.23: He has weakened my strength in the way; He has shortened my days.
102.19: For He looked down from His holy height; From heaven the LORD gazed upon the earth,
102.1: A Prayer of the Afflicted when he is faint and pours out his complaint before the LORD. Hear my prayer, O LORD! And let my cry for help come to You.
102.5: Because of the loudness of my groaning My bones cling to my flesh.
102.4: My heart has been smitten like grass and has withered away, Indeed, I forget to eat my bread.
102.8: My enemies have reproached me all day long; Those who deride me have used my [name] as a curse.
102.26: 'Even they will perish, but You endure; And all of them will wear out like a garment; Like clothing You will change them and they will be changed.
102.14: Surely Your servants find pleasure in her stones And feel pity for her dust.
102.22: When the peoples are gathered together, And the kingdoms, to serve the LORD.
102.28: 'The children of Your servants will continue, And their descendants will be established before You.'
102.25: 'Of old You founded the earth, And the heavens are the work of Your hands.
102.9: For I have eaten ashes like bread And mingled my drink with weeping
102.15: So the nations will fear the name of the LORD And all the kings of the earth Your glory.
102.21: That [men] may tell of the name of the LORD in Zion And His praise in Jerusalem,
102.24: I say, 'O my God, do not take me away in the midst of my days, Your years are throughout all generations.
102.16: For the LORD has built up Zion; He has appeared in His glory.
102.7: I lie awake, I have become like a lonely bird on a housetop.
102.2: Do not hide Your face from me in the day of my distress; Incline Your ear to me; In the day when I call answer me quickly.
102.6: I resemble a pelican of the wilderness; I have become like an owl of the waste places.

136.16: To Him who led His people through the wilderness, For His lovingkindness is everlasting;
136.3: Give thanks to the Lord of lords, For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
136.5: To Him who made the heavens with skill, For His lovingkindness is everlasting;
136.21: And gave their land as a heritage, For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
136.18: And slew mighty kings, For His lovingkindness is everlasting:
136.12: With a strong hand and an outstretched arm, For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
136.10: To Him who smote the Egyptians in their firstborn, For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
136.2: Give thanks to the God of gods, For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
136.22: Even a heritage to Israel His servant, For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
136.8: The sun to rule by day, For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
136.17: To Him who smote great kings, For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
136.11: And brought Israel out from their midst, For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
136.1: Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good, For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
136.9: The moon and stars to rule by night, For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
136.24: And has rescued us from our adversaries, For His lovingkindness is everlasting;
136.14: And made Israel pass through the midst of it, For His lovingkindness is everlasting;
136.7: To Him who made [the] great lights, For His lovingkindness is everlasting:
136.15: But He overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea, For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
136.20: And Og, king of Bashan, For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
136.25: Who gives food to all flesh, For His lovingkindness is everlasting.
136.23: Who remembered us in our low estate, For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
136.6: To Him who spread out the earth above the waters, For His lovingkindness is everlasting;
136.4: To Him who alone does great wonders, For His lovingkindness is everlasting;
136.19: Sihon, king of the Amorites, For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
136.13: To Him who divided the Red Sea asunder, For His lovingkindness is everlasting,
136.26: Give thanks to the God of heaven, For His lovingkindness is everlasting.

55.16: As for me, I shall call upon God, And the LORD will save me.
55.3: Because of the voice of the enemy, Because of the pressure of the wicked; For they bring down trouble upon me And in anger they bear a grudge against me.
55.5: Fear and trembling come upon me, And horror has overwhelmed me.
55.21: His speech was smoother than butter, But his heart was war; His words were softer than oil, Yet they were drawn swords.
55.18: He will redeem my soul in peace from the battle [which is] against me, For they are many [who strive] with me.
55.12: For it is not an enemy who reproaches me, Then I could bear [it]; Nor is it one who hates me who has exalted himself against me, Then I could hide myself from him.
55.10: Day and night they go around her upon her walls, And iniquity and mischief are in her midst.
55.2: Give heed to me and answer me; I am restless in my complaint and am surely distracted,
55.22: Cast your burden upon the LORD and He will sustain you; He will never allow the righteous to be shaken.
55.8: 'I would hasten to my place of refuge From the stormy wind [and] tempest.'
55.17: Evening and morning and at noon, I will complain and murmur, And He will hear my voice.
55.11: Destruction is in her midst; Oppression and deceit do not depart from her streets.
55.1: For the choir director; on stringed instruments. A Maskil of David. Give ear to my prayer, O God; And do not hide Yourself from my supplication.
55.9: Confuse, O Lord, divide their tongues, For I have seen violence and strife in the city.
55.14: We who had sweet fellowship together Walked in the house of God in the throng.
55.7: 'Behold, I would wander far away, I would lodge in the wilderness. Selah.
55.15: Let death come deceitfully upon them; Let them go down alive to Sheol, For evil is in their dwelling, in their midst.
55.20: He has put forth his hands against those who were at peace with him; He has violated his covenant.
55.23: But You, O God, will bring them down to the pit of destruction; Men of bloodshed and deceit will not live out half their days. But I will trust in You.
55.6: I said, 'Oh, that I had wings like a dove! I would fly away and be at rest.
55.4: My heart is in anguish within me, And the terrors of death have fallen upon me.
55.19: God will hear and answer them-- Even the one who sits enthroned from of old-- Selah. With whom there is no change, And who do not fear God.
55.13: But it is you, a man my equal, My companion and my familiar friend;

131.2: Surely I have composed and quieted my soul; Like a weaned child [rests] against his mother, My soul is like a weaned child within me.
131.1: A Song of Ascents, of David. O LORD, my heart is not proud, nor my eyes haughty; Nor do I involve myself in great matters, Or in things too difficult for me.
131.3: O Israel, hope in the LORD From this time forth and forever.

22.11: Be not far from me, for trouble is near; For there is none to help.
22.3: Yet You are holy, O You who are enthroned upon the praises of Israel.
22.20: Deliver my soul from the sword, My only [life] from the power of the dog.
22.12: Many bulls have surrounded me; Strong [bulls] of Bashan have encircled me.
22.10: Upon You I was cast from birth; You have been my God from my mother's womb.
22.17: I can count all my bones. They look, they stare at me;
22.13: They open wide their mouth at me, As a ravening and a roaring lion.
22.27: All the ends of the earth will remember and turn to the LORD, And all the families of the nations will worship before You.
22.30: Posterity will serve Him; It will be told of the Lord to the [coming] generation.
22.18: They divide my garments among them, And for my clothing they cast lots.
22.29: All the prosperous of the earth will eat and worship, All those who go down to the dust will bow before Him, Even he who cannot keep his soul alive.
22.23: You who fear the LORD, praise Him; All you descendants of Jacob, glorify Him, And stand in awe of Him, all you descendants of Israel.
22.19: But You, O LORD, be not far off; O You my help, hasten to my assistance.
22.1: For the choir director; upon Aijeleth Hashshahar. A Psalm of David. My God, my God, why have You forsaken me? Far from my deliverance are the words of my groaning.
22.5: To You they cried out and were delivered; In You they trusted and were not disappointed.
22.4: In You our fathers trusted; They trusted and You delivered them.
22.8: 'Commit [yourself] to the LORD; let Him deliver him; Let Him rescue him, because He delights in him.'
22.26: The afflicted will eat and be satisfied; Those who seek Him will praise the LORD. Let your heart live forever!
22.14: I am poured out like water, And all my bones are out of joint; My heart is like wax; It is melted within me.
22.22: I will tell of Your name to my brethren; In the midst of the assembly I will praise You.
22.28: For the kingdom is the LORD'S And He rules over the nations.
22.25: From You [comes] my praise in the great assembly; I shall pay my vows before those who fear Him.
22.9: Yet You are He who brought me forth from the womb; You made me trust [when] upon my mother's breasts.
22.15: My strength is dried up like a potsherd, And my tongue cleaves to my jaws; And You lay me in the dust of death.
22.21: Save me from the lion's mouth; From the horns of the wild oxen You answer me.
22.24: For He has not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; Nor has He hidden His face from him; But when he cried to Him for help, He heard.
22.16: For dogs have surrounded me; A band of evildoers has encompassed me; They pierced my hands and my feet.
22.7: All who see me sneer at me; They separate with the lip, they wag the head, [saying],
22.2: O my God, I cry by day, but You do not answer; And by night, but I have no rest.
22.6: But I am a worm and not a man, A reproach of men and despised by the people.
22.31: They will come and will declare His righteousness To a people who will be born, that He has performed [it].

44.16: Because of the voice of him who reproaches and reviles, Because of the presence of the enemy and the avenger.
44.3: For by their own sword they did not possess the land, And their own arm did not save them, But Your right hand and Your arm and the light of Your presence, For You favored them.
44.5: Through You we will push back our adversaries; Through Your name we will trample down those who rise up against us.
44.21: Would not God find this out? For He knows the secrets of the heart.
44.18: Our heart has not turned back, And our steps have not deviated from Your way,
44.12: You sell Your people cheaply, And have not profited by their sale.
44.10: You cause us to turn back from the adversary; And those who hate us have taken spoil for themselves.
44.2: You with Your own hand drove out the nations; Then You planted them; You afflicted the peoples, Then You spread them abroad.
44.22: But for Your sake we are killed all day long; We are considered as sheep to be slaughtered.
44.8: In God we have boasted all day long, And we will give thanks to Your name forever. Selah.
44.17: All this has come upon us, but we have not forgotten You, And we have not dealt falsely with Your covenant.
44.11: You give us as sheep to be eaten And have scattered us among the nations.
44.1: For the choir director. A Maskil of the sons of Korah. O God, we have heard with our ears, Our fathers have told us The work that You did in their days, In the days of old.
44.9: Yet You have rejected [us] and brought us to dishonor, And do not go out with our armies.
44.24: Why do You hide Your face [And] forget our affliction and our oppression?
44.14: You make us a byword among the nations, A laughingstock among the peoples.
44.7: But You have saved us from our adversaries, And You have put to shame those who hate us.
44.15: All day long my dishonor is before me And my humiliation has overwhelmed me,
44.20: If we had forgotten the name of our God Or extended our hands to a strange god,
44.25: For our soul has sunk down into the dust; Our body cleaves to the earth.
44.23: Arouse Yourself, why do You sleep, O Lord? Awake, do not reject us forever.
44.6: For I will not trust in my bow, Nor will my sword save me.
44.4: You are my King, O God; Command victories for Jacob.
44.19: Yet You have crushed us in a place of jackals And covered us with the shadow of death.
44.13: You make us a reproach to our neighbors, A scoffing and a derision to those around us.
44.26: Rise up, be our help, And redeem us for the sake of Your lovingkindness.

109.11: Let the creditor seize all that he has, And let strangers plunder the product of his labor.
109.3: They have also surrounded me with words of hatred, And fought against me without cause.
109.20: Let this be the reward of my accusers from the LORD, And of those who speak evil against my soul.
109.12: Let there be none to extend lovingkindness to him, Nor any to be gracious to his fatherless children.
109.10: Let his children wander about and beg; And let them seek [sustenance] far from their ruined homes.
109.17: He also loved cursing, so it came to him; And he did not delight in blessing, so it was far from him.
109.13: Let his posterity be cut off; In a following generation let their name be blotted out.
109.27: And let them know that this is Your hand; You, LORD, have done it.
109.30: With my mouth I will give thanks abundantly to the LORD; And in the midst of many I will praise Him.
109.18: But he clothed himself with cursing as with his garment, And it entered into his body like water And like oil into his bones.
109.29: Let my accusers be clothed with dishonor, And let them cover themselves with their own shame as with a robe.
109.23: I am passing like a shadow when it lengthens; I am shaken off like the locust.
109.19: Let it be to him as a garment with which he covers himself, And for a belt with which he constantly girds himself.
109.1: For the choir director. A Psalm of David. O God of my praise, Do not be silent!
109.5: Thus they have repaid me evil for good And hatred for my love.
109.4: In return for my love they act as my accusers; But I am [in] prayer.
109.8: Let his days be few; Let another take his office.
109.26: Help me, O LORD my God; Save me according to Your lovingkindness.
109.14: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the LORD, And do not let the sin of his mother be blotted out.
109.22: For I am afflicted and needy, And my heart is wounded within me.
109.28: Let them curse, but You bless; When they arise, they shall be ashamed, But Your servant shall be glad.
109.25: I also have become a reproach to them; When they see me, they wag their head.
109.9: Let his children be fatherless And his wife a widow.
109.15: Let them be before the LORD continually, That He may cut off their memory from the earth;
109.21: But You, O GOD, the Lord, deal [kindly] with me for Your name's sake; Because Your lovingkindness is good, deliver me;
109.24: My knees are weak from fasting, And my flesh has grown lean, without fatness.
109.16: Because he did not remember to show lovingkindness, But persecuted the afflicted and needy man, And the despondent in heart, to put [them] to death.
109.7: When he is judged, let him come forth guilty, And let his prayer become sin.
109.2: For they have opened the wicked and deceitful mouth against me; They have spoken against me with a lying tongue.
109.6: Appoint a wicked man over him, And let an accuser stand at his right hand.
109.31: For He stands at the right hand of the needy, To save him from those who judge his soul.

61.7: He will abide before God forever; Appoint lovingkindness and truth that they may preserve him.
61.3: For You have been a refuge for me, A tower of strength against the enemy.
61.2: From the end of the earth I call to You when my heart is faint; Lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
61.1: For the choir director; on a stringed instrument. [A Psalm] of David. Hear my cry, O God; Give heed to my prayer.
61.4: Let me dwell in Your tent forever; Let me take refuge in the shelter of Your wings. Selah.
61.6: You will prolong the king's life; His years will be as many generations.
61.5: For You have heard my vows, O God; You have given [me] the inheritance of those who fear Your name.
61.8: So I will sing praise to Your name forever, That I may pay my vows day by day.

15.2: He who walks with integrity, and works righteousness, And speaks truth in his heart.
15.4: In whose eyes a reprobate is despised, But who honors those who fear the LORD; He swears to his own hurt and does not change;
15.5: He does not put out his money at interest, Nor does he take a bribe against the innocent. He who does these things will never be shaken.
15.1: A Psalm of David. O LORD, who may abide in Your tent? Who may dwell on Your holy hill?
15.3: He does not slander with his tongue, Nor does evil to his neighbor, Nor takes up a reproach against his friend;

140.3: They sharpen their tongues as a serpent; Poison of a viper is under their lips. Selah.
140.5: The proud have hidden a trap for me, and cords; They have spread a net by the wayside; They have set snares for me. Selah.
140.12: I know that the LORD will maintain the cause of the afflicted And justice for the poor.
140.10: 'May burning coals fall upon them; May they be cast into the fire, Into deep pits from which they cannot rise.
140.2: Who devise evil things in [their] hearts; They continually stir up wars.
140.8: 'Do not grant, O LORD, the desires of the wicked; Do not promote his [evil] device, [that] they [not] be exalted. Selah.
140.11: 'May a slanderer not be established in the earth; May evil hunt the violent man speedily.'
140.1: For the choir director. A Psalm of David. Rescue me, O LORD, from evil men; Preserve me from violent men
140.9: 'As for the head of those who surround me, May the mischief of their lips cover them.
140.7: 'O GOD the Lord, the strength of my salvation, You have covered my head in the day of battle.
140.6: I said to the LORD, 'You are my God; Give ear, O LORD, to the voice of my supplications.
140.4: Keep me, O LORD, from the hands of the wicked; Preserve me from violent men Who have purposed to trip up my feet.
140.13: Surely the righteous will give thanks to Your name; The upright will dwell in Your presence.

86.16: Turn to me, and be gracious to me; Oh grant Your strength to Your servant, And save the son of Your handmaid.
86.3: Be gracious to me, O Lord, For to You I cry all day long.
86.5: For You, Lord, are good, and ready to forgive, And abundant in lovingkindness to all who call upon You.
86.12: I will give thanks to You, O Lord my God, with all my heart, And will glorify Your name forever.
86.10: For You are great and do wondrous deeds; You alone are God.
86.2: Preserve my soul, for I am a godly man; O You my God, save Your servant who trusts in You.
86.8: There is no one like You among the gods, O Lord, Nor are there any works like Yours.
86.17: Show me a sign for good, That those who hate me may see [it] and be ashamed, Because You, O LORD, have helped me and comforted me.
86.11: Teach me Your way, O LORD; I will walk in Your truth; Unite my heart to fear Your name.
86.1: A Prayer of David. Incline Your ear, O LORD, [and] answer me; For I am afflicted and needy.
86.9: All nations whom You have made shall come and worship before You, O Lord, And they shall glorify Your name.
86.14: O God, arrogant men have risen up against me, And a band of violent men have sought my life, And they have not set You before them.
86.7: In the day of my trouble I shall call upon You, For You will answer me.
86.15: But You, O Lord, are a God merciful and gracious, Slow to anger and abundant in lovingkindness and truth.
86.6: Give ear, O LORD, to my prayer; And give heed to the voice of my supplications!
86.4: Make glad the soul of Your servant, For to You, O Lord, I lift up my soul.
86.13: For Your lovingkindness toward me is great, And You have delivered my soul from the depths of Sheol.

26.7: That I may proclaim with the voice of thanksgiving And declare all Your wonders.
26.9: Do not take my soul away [along] with sinners, Nor my life with men of bloodshed,
26.10: In whose hands is a wicked scheme, And whose right hand is full of bribes.
26.3: For Your lovingkindness is before my eyes, And I have walked in Your truth.
26.11: But as for me, I shall walk in my integrity; Redeem me, and be gracious to me.
26.2: Examine me, O LORD, and try me; Test my mind and my heart.
26.1: [A Psalm] of David. Vindicate me, O LORD, for I have walked in my integrity, And I have trusted in the LORD without wavering.
26.12: My foot stands on a level place; In the congregations I shall bless the LORD.
26.4: I do not sit with deceitful men, Nor will I go with pretenders.
26.6: I shall wash my hands in innocence, And I will go about Your altar, O LORD,
26.5: I hate the assembly of evildoers, And I will not sit with the wicked.
26.8: O LORD, I love the habitation of Your house And the place where Your glory dwells.

138.7: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, You will revive me; You will stretch forth Your hand against the wrath of my enemies, And Your right hand will save me.
138.3: On the day I called, You answered me; You made me bold with strength in my soul.
138.2: I will bow down toward Your holy temple And give thanks to Your name for Your lovingkindness and Your truth; For You have magnified Your word according to all Your name.
138.1: [A Psalm] of David. I will give You thanks with all my heart; I will sing praises to You before the gods.
138.4: All the kings of the earth will give thanks to You, O LORD, When they have heard the words of Your mouth.
138.6: For though the LORD is exalted, Yet He regards the lowly, But the haughty He knows from afar.
138.5: And they will sing of the ways of the LORD, For great is the glory of the LORD.
138.8: The LORD will accomplish what concerns me; Your lovingkindness, O LORD, is everlasting; Do not forsake the works of Your hands.

36.7: How precious is Your lovingkindness, O God! And the children of men take refuge in the shadow of Your wings.
36.9: For with You is the fountain of life; In Your light we see light.
36.10: O continue Your lovingkindness to those who know You, And Your righteousness to the upright in heart.
36.3: The words of his mouth are wickedness and deceit; He has ceased to be wise [and] to do good.
36.11: Let not the foot of pride come upon me, And let not the hand of the wicked drive me away.
36.2: For it flatters him in his [own] eyes Concerning the discovery of his iniquity [and] the hatred [of it].
36.1: For the choir director. [A Psalm] of David the servant of the LORD. Transgression speaks to the ungodly within his heart; There is no fear of God before his eyes.
36.12: There the doers of iniquity have fallen; They have been thrust down and cannot rise.
36.4: He plans wickedness upon his bed; He sets himself on a path that is not good; He does not despise evil.
36.6: Your righteousness is like the mountains of God; Your judgments are [like] a great deep. O LORD, You preserve man and beast.
36.5: Your lovingkindness, O LORD, extends to the heavens, Your faithfulness [reaches] to the skies.
36.8: They drink their fill of the abundance of Your house; And You give them to drink of the river of Your delights.

38.16: For I said, 'May they not rejoice over me, [Who], when my foot slips, would magnify themselves against me.'
38.3: There is no soundness in my flesh because of Your indignation; There is no health in my bones because of my sin.
38.5: My wounds grow foul [and] fester Because of my folly.
38.21: Do not forsake me, O LORD; O my God, do not be far from me!
38.18: For I confess my iniquity; I am full of anxiety because of my sin.
38.12: Those who seek my life lay snares [for me]; And those who seek to injure me have threatened destruction, And they devise treachery all day long.
38.10: My heart throbs, my strength fails me; And the light of my eyes, even that has gone from me.
38.2: For Your arrows have sunk deep into me, And Your hand has pressed down on me.
38.22: Make haste to help me, O Lord, my salvation!
38.8: I am benumbed and badly crushed; I groan because of the agitation of my heart.
38.17: For I am ready to fall, And my sorrow is continually before me.
38.11: My loved ones and my friends stand aloof from my plague; And my kinsmen stand afar off.
38.1: A Psalm of David, for a memorial. O LORD, rebuke me not in Your wrath, And chasten me not in Your burning anger.
38.9: Lord, all my desire is before You; And my sighing is not hidden from You.
38.14: Yes, I am like a man who does not hear, And in whose mouth are no arguments.
38.7: For my loins are filled with burning, And there is no soundness in my flesh.
38.15: For I hope in You, O LORD; You will answer, O Lord my God.
38.20: And those who repay evil for good, They oppose me, because I follow what is good.
38.6: I am bent over and greatly bowed down; I go mourning all day long.
38.4: For my iniquities are gone over my head; As a heavy burden they weigh too much for me.
38.19: But my enemies are vigorous [and] strong, And many are those who hate me wrongfully.
38.13: But I, like a deaf man, do not hear; And [I am] like a mute man who does not open his mouth.

7.16: His mischief will return upon his own head, And his violence will descend upon his own pate.
7.3: O LORD my God, if I have done this, If there is injustice in my hands,
7.5: Let the enemy pursue my soul and overtake [it]; And let him trample my life down to the ground And lay my glory in the dust. Selah.
7.12: If a man does not repent, He will sharpen His sword; He has bent His bow and made it ready.
7.10: My shield is with God, Who saves the upright in heart.
7.2: Or he will tear my soul like a lion, Dragging me away, while there is none to deliver.
7.8: The LORD judges the peoples; Vindicate me, O LORD, according to my righteousness and my integrity that is in me.
7.17: I will give thanks to the LORD according to His righteousness And will sing praise to the name of the LORD Most High.
7.11: God is a righteous judge, And a God who has indignation every day.
7.1: A Shiggaion of David, which he sang to the LORD concerning Cush, a Benjamite. O LORD my God, in You I have taken refuge; Save me from all those who pursue me, and deliver me,
7.9: O let the evil of the wicked come to an end, but establish the righteous; For the righteous God tries the hearts and minds.
7.14: Behold, he travails with wickedness, And he conceives mischief and brings forth falsehood.
7.7: Let the assembly of the peoples encompass You, And over them return on high.
7.15: He has dug a pit and hollowed it out, And has fallen into the hole which he made.
7.6: Arise, O LORD, in Your anger; Lift up Yourself against the rage of my adversaries, And arouse Yourself for me; You have appointed judgment.
7.4: If I have rewarded evil to my friend, Or have plundered him who without cause was my adversary,
7.13: He has also prepared for Himself deadly weapons; He makes His arrows fiery shafts.

63.7: For You have been my help, And in the shadow of Your wings I sing for joy.
63.9: But those who seek my life to destroy it, Will go into the depths of the earth.
63.10: They will be delivered over to the power of the sword; They will be a prey for foxes.
63.3: Because Your lovingkindness is better than life, My lips will praise You.
63.11: But the king will rejoice in God; Everyone who swears by Him will glory, For the mouths of those who speak lies will be stopped.
63.2: Thus I have seen You in the sanctuary, To see Your power and Your glory.
63.1: A Psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah. O God, You are my God; I shall seek You earnestly; My soul thirsts for You, my flesh yearns for You, In a dry and weary land where there is no water.
63.4: So I will bless You as long as I live; I will lift up my hands in Your name.
63.6: When I remember You on my bed, I meditate on You in the night watches,
63.5: My soul is satisfied as with marrow and fatness, And my mouth offers praises with joyful lips.
63.8: My soul clings to You; Your right hand upholds me.

124.7: Our soul has escaped as a bird out of the snare of the trapper; The snare is broken and we have escaped.
124.3: Then they would have swallowed us alive, When their anger was kindled against us;
124.2: 'Had it not been the LORD who was on our side When men rose up against us,
124.1: A Song of Ascents, of David. 'Had it not been the LORD who was on our side,' Let Israel now say,
124.4: Then the waters would have engulfed us, The stream would have swept over our soul;
124.6: Blessed be the LORD, Who has not given us to be torn by their teeth.
124.5: Then the raging waters would have swept over our soul.'
124.8: Our help is in the name of the LORD, Who made heaven and earth.

148.3: Praise Him, sun and moon; Praise Him, all stars of light!
148.5: Let them praise the name of the LORD, For He commanded and they were created.
148.12: Both young men and virgins; Old men and children.
148.10: Beasts and all cattle; Creeping things and winged fowl;
148.2: Praise Him, all His angels; Praise Him, all His hosts!
148.8: Fire and hail, snow and clouds; Stormy wind, fulfilling His word;
148.11: Kings of the earth and all peoples; Princes and all judges of the earth;
148.1: Praise the LORD! Praise the LORD from the heavens; Praise Him in the heights!
148.9: Mountains and all hills; Fruit trees and all cedars;
148.14: And He has lifted up a horn for His people, Praise for all His godly ones; [Even] for the sons of Israel, a people near to Him. Praise the LORD!
148.7: Praise the LORD from the earth, Sea monsters and all deeps;
148.6: He has also established them forever and ever; He has made a decree which will not pass away.
148.4: Praise Him, highest heavens, And the waters that are above the heavens!
148.13: Let them praise the name of the LORD, For His name alone is exalted; His glory is above earth and heaven.

95.7: For He is our God, And we are the people of His pasture and the sheep of His hand. Today, if you would hear His voice,
95.9: 'When your fathers tested Me, They tried Me, though they had seen My work.
95.10: 'For forty years I loathed [that] generation, And said they are a people who err in their heart, And they do not know My ways.
95.3: For the LORD is a great God And a great King above all gods,
95.11: 'Therefore I swore in My anger, Truly they shall not enter into My rest.'
95.2: Let us come before His presence with thanksgiving, Let us shout joyfully to Him with psalms.
95.1: O come, let us sing for joy to the LORD, Let us shout joyfully to the rock of our salvation.
95.4: In whose hand are the depths of the earth, The peaks of the mountains are His also.
95.6: Come, let us worship and bow down, Let us kneel before the LORD our Maker.
95.5: The sea is His, for it was He who made it, And His hands formed the dry land.
95.8: Do not harden your hearts, as at Meribah, As in the day of Massah in the wilderness,
